meanings.definition: A line of people or objects enclosing an area.
meanings.sent1: During the parade, the police formed a cordon to keep the crowd safe.
meanings.sent2: The security team set up a cordon around the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The cordon of caution tape made the area look like a giant present.
meanings.sent4: The cordon of trees around the park created a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The cordon of volunteers guided visitors through the museum.

meanings.definition: To form a cordon around something.
meanings.sent1: The officers will cordon off the area for investigation.
meanings.sent2: Please cordon the VIP section for the event.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to cordon off the kitchen to surprise the guests.
meanings.sent4: The security team will cordon the building to ensure safety.
meanings.sent5: They will cordon the stage before the performance begins.

meanings.definition: A ribbon or cord worn as a decoration or badge.
meanings.sent1: She proudly wore the cordon of honor around her neck.
meanings.sent2: The medal came with a beautiful cordon to display it.
meanings.sent3: The cordon of bravery added a touch of elegance to his uniform.
meanings.sent4: The cordon of achievement symbolized her hard work.
meanings.sent5: The cordon of friendship was a meaningful gift.
